intro: Erysimastrum cretaceum, commonly known as the cretaceous erysimastrum, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually yellow or orange in color. Erysimastrum cretaceum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and canyons, where it thrives in full sun.
